q1-business-description: Helping individuals learn online through a platform that offers courses and mentorship across different fields.
q2-problem-transformation: Before: traders and self-learners are stuck with low-quality content, misleading signals, and no real path to income. After: they gain marketable, high-paying skills, build additional income streams, and sustain their trading journey long-term — through real education, not noise.
q3-ideal-customer: A 20-year-old seeking real, practical ways to make money online — someone who values substance over hype and wants tangible, high-income skills rather than empty promises or quick-fix signals.
q4-competitors:
TRW (Hustlers University) is the closest business model reference — strong teaching methods and clear positioning. Coursera is in the same niche but doesn't address real income generation for the target audience.

Brands to avoid resembling: the forex/trading signal community in general — their identities are generic, outdated, and symbol-heavy (profit arrows, candle charts, winning trophies). No meaning, no differentiation. 3008 University should look nothing like that world.
q5-brand-personality: Confident — some may read it as arrogant, but it's unapologetic conviction in the value delivered. The brand is serious and direct, leaning clean and minimal over expressive. It sits in a balanced space between approachable and authoritative. Core values: accessibility, quality delivery, and client experience. The personality is that of a bold mentor — someone who speaks with authority but genuinely wants others to succeed.
q6-positioning: We are the only online university that provides high-paying skills through structured, outcome-driven education programs.
q8-brands-admired: Nike (Just Do It) / Coursera (Learn Without Limits) / TRW (Escape The Matrix) / Udemy (Be Able) / BMW (The Ultimate Driving Machine) — all admired for strong, purposeful messaging and clean premium identities.
q10-colors-to-avoid: Avoid anything cheap, flashy, or overly saturated — no neons or bright vivid tones. Deep blue is preferred and should anchor the palette; any direction that undermines a premium, serious feeling should be avoided.
q11-aesthetic-description: Typography: geometric sans-serif for body and UI, with a condensed display typeface for headlines — modern, strong, and commanding. The brand environment feels like a high-end, minimal office: clean white space, soft lighting, computer workstations, a meeting table with a large screen, and a coffee corner. The visual identity should carry that same controlled, premium energy throughout.
q12-existing-assets: No existing assets to preserve — open to a completely fresh visual identity built from the ground up.
q14-budget: Best possible result no matter the cost
q16-anything-else: Main focus right now is scaling this brand through personal branding and monetization. The three-year vision: compete with the biggest e-learning platforms in the niche and become the number one online education brand in North Africa. The visual identity's job is to be unforgettable and build that authority from day one. First emotion this brand should make people feel: excited.
